results.title: ‘Black Panther: Wakanda Forever’ Ends Box Office Drought
results.abstract: Turnout was especially strong at large-format IMAX theaters, where domestic ticket sales of $14.2 million set a record for a November opening.

multimedia.caption: Angela Bassett as Ramonda in “Black Panther: Wakanda Forever,” directed by Ryan Coogler.
Angela Bassett as Ramonda in “Black Panther: Wakanda Forever,” directed by Ryan Coogler.
Angela Bassett as Ramonda in “Black Panther: Wakanda Forever,” directed by Ryan Coogler.

results.title: ‘The Fabelmans’ Review: Steven Spielberg Phones Home
results.abstract: The director’s latest movie focuses on a budding filmmaker a lot like himself. But Michelle Williams, as his mother, is the soul of this fractious family drama.

multimedia.caption: The actor Gabriel LaBelle plays an adolescent Sammy Fabelman, a stand-in for Steven Spielberg.

results.title: ‘Black Panther: Wakanda Forever’ Review: Women on the Home Front
results.abstract: Shadowed by Chadwick Boseman’s death, this sequel focuses on King T’Challa’s mother and the women helping her to contend with a slippery new villain.

multimedia.caption: In “Black Panther: Wakanda Forever,” T’Challa’s mother, Queen Ramonda (Angela Bassett), center, has assumed the throne.
In “Black Panther: Wakanda Forever,” T’Challa’s mother, Queen Ramonda (Angela Bassett), center, has assumed the throne.

results.title: For Elvis Mitchell, Critic Turned Filmmaker, a Chance to Show and Tell
results.abstract: His new documentary on Netflix, “Is That Black Enough for You?!?,” spotlights unsung Black cinema of the 1970s.
des_facet: Is That Black Enough For You?!? (Movie)

multimedia.caption: “We hear about Blaxploitation as if that’s the sole definition of movies that came out at the time,” Elvis Mitchell said. “But that’s reductive and just not true.”
multimedia.copyright: Simbarashe Cha for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: “We hear about Blaxploitation as if that’s the sole definition of movies that came out at the time,” Elvis Mitchell said. “But that’s reductive and just not true.”

results.title: Steven Spielberg Gets Personal
results.abstract: In making his autobiographical film “The Fabelmans,” he confronted some painful family secrets, as well as what it means to be Jewish in America today.

multimedia.caption: After more than 50 years, this is the director’s most personal film yet.
multimedia.copyright: Chantal Anderson for The New York Times

results.title: ‘A Couple’ Review: Tolstoy Story
results.abstract: In a rare turn to dramatic work, Frederick Wiseman directs a one-woman film about the long-suffering wife of a famous author.

results.abstract: Lindsay Lohan stars as an amnesiac who falls off a mountain and in love in this Netflix holiday romance that is all too familiar.

results.abstract: A boy befriends a colorful creature in this animated film that struggles to maintain a consistent tone.

results.title: Nan Goldin and Laura Poitras: Two Artists, One Devastating Film
results.abstract: The documentary “All the Beauty and the Bloodshed” tells a complex story of personal trauma and protest. But first the collaborators needed to reach an agreement.
des_facet: All the Beauty and the Bloodshed (Movie)

multimedia.caption: Though Laura Poitras was the director, Nan Goldin, above, served as a producer and had a say in what material was used.

results.title: ‘In Her Hands’ Review: A Young Woman’s Resolve as Life Unravels
results.abstract: Hillary and Chelsea Clinton executive produced this documentary, which follows a young Afghan mayor as she navigates upheavals wrought by the Taliban’s return to power.

multimedia.caption: Zarifa Ghafari as seen in the documentary “In Her Hands.”
Zarifa Ghafari as seen in the documentary “In Her Hands.”

results.title: ‘Memories of My Father’ Review: Death of a Patriarch
results.abstract: Directed by Fernando Trueba, this treacly melodrama focuses on the Colombian writer Héctor Abad Faciolince’s coming-of-age as shaped by his father, the doctor and human rights leader Héctor Abad Gómez.

multimedia.caption: Javier Cámara, right, with Nicolás Reyes Cano, left, in “Memories of My Father.”
Javier Cámara, right, with Nicolás Reyes Cano, left, in “Memories of My Father.”

results.title: Kevin Spacey Faces New Sexual Assault Charges in U.K.
results.abstract: The authorities authorized seven new counts against the actor, including three for sexual assault. Mr. Spacey was already facing a criminal trial in Britain.

multimedia.caption: The actor Kevin Spacey attended a hearing at the Central Criminal Court in London in July over charges of sexual assault.
The actor Kevin Spacey attended a hearing at the Central Criminal Court in London in July over charges of sexual assault.
The actor Kevin Spacey attended a hearing at the Central Criminal Court in London in July over charges of sexual assault.

results.title: How ‘The Lion King’ Got to Broadway and Ruled for 25 Years (So Far)
results.abstract: A surprising collaboration between an entertainment giant (Disney) and an avant-garde artist (Julie Taymor) birthed the most successful musical in history.

multimedia.caption: Julie Taymor, who not only directed the show but also designed its costumes, puppets and masks, became the first woman to win a Tony Award for directing a musical. “I like challenges,” she said of the project.

Julie Taymor, who not only directed the show but also designed its costumes, puppets and masks, became the first woman to win a Tony Award for directing a musical. “I like challenges,” she said of the project.

results.abstract: In his documentary, Jonah Hill gently turns the tables on the psychiatrist and author Phil Stutz.

Phil Stutz, the subject of the documentary “Stutz,” directed by Jonah Hill.

results.title: ‘Master of Light’ Review: Rebuilding Through Rembrandt
results.abstract: The painter George Anthony Morton, who spent his 20s in prison on a drug conviction, is the subject of this documentary coming to HBO Max.

multimedia.caption: George Anthony Morton working on a self-portrait, as seen in the documentary “Master of Light.”
George Anthony Morton working on a self-portrait, as seen in the documentary “Master of Light.”
George Anthony Morton working on a self-portrait, as seen in the documentary “Master of Light.”

results.title: Mehran Karimi Nasseri, Who Inspired ‘The Terminal,’ Dies in Paris Airport
results.abstract: He slept on a bench in Charles de Gaulle Airport for 18 years, stuck in limbo as a refugee. His story inspired a Steven Spielberg film with Tom Hanks.

multimedia.caption: Mehran Karimi Nasseri in 2004 at Charles de Gaulle Airport in Paris standing by the poster of the movie that was inspired by his life. He died on Saturday inside the airport.
multimedia.copyright: Stephane De Sakutin/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

results.title: ‘Wakanda Forever’ Forges International Alliances on a Somber Soundtrack
results.abstract: Rihanna, Burna Boy, Snow Tha Product and Stormzy perform songs from and inspired by the second “Black Panther” movie.

multimedia.caption: “Black Panther: Wakanda Forever (Music From and Inspired By)” draws on musicians and instruments from Africa and Mexico along with American and British rappers and singers.

results.title: Examining the Regrettably Modern Marriage of Leo Tolstoy and Sophia Tolstaya
results.abstract: Frederick Wiseman set aside the documentaries he’s known for to work on “A Couple,” a solo drama putting Leo Tolstoy’s much-burdened wife at its center.

multimedia.caption: “A Couple” is based in part on the diaries of Sophia Tolstaya.
“A Couple” is based in part on the diaries of Sophia Tolstaya.

results.title: Jury Says Paul Haggis Raped Woman After Film Premiere
results.abstract: Mr. Haggis, a writer of the Oscar-winning films “Crash” and “Million Dollar Baby,” was sued by a film publicist after a 2013 encounter in his New York apartment.

multimedia.caption: Paul Haggis said that a sexual encounter after a film premiere in 2013 was consensual. His accuser said she was raped in his apartment.
Paul Haggis said that a sexual encounter after a film premiere in 2013 was consensual. His accuser said she was raped in his apartment.

results.abstract: Quiz yourself on seven classic screen adaptations — and what some novelists had to say about them.

results.title: ‘Retrograde’ Review: The U.S. Withdrawal From Afghanistan
results.abstract: This documentary follows one Afghan general, Sami Sadat, to tell an emotional story.

multimedia.caption: In “Retrograde,” shot over the nine months after the confirmation of the U.S. withdrawal from Afghanistan, the filmmakers single out scenes of vulnerability, fear and sheer nerves.

results.title: ‘The First Noelle’ Review: All I Want for Christmas Is My Ex
results.abstract: A young Black editor is set on winning back her ex-boyfriend this Christmas — even if it means breaking up his relationship.

results.title: ‘Nothing Lasts Forever’ Review: Mining the Diamond Myth
results.abstract: This documentary positions an intriguing investigation into the rise of synthetic diamonds within a broader excavation of the myths these stones carry.

multimedia.caption: Jason Kohn’s documentary dissects the diamond industry.
Jason Kohn’s documentary dissects the diamond industry.

results.title: Warren Beatty Is Accused of Sexually Assaulting a Minor in 1973
results.abstract: In a lawsuit filed this week, the plaintiff says Mr. Beatty groomed and coerced her into sex when she was 14 and 15. The actor, who had starred in “Bonnie and Clyde,” was about 35 at the time.

multimedia.caption: The plaintiff says Warren Beatty caused her “severe emotional, physical and psychological distress.”
multimedia.copyright: Mark Von Holden/Invision, via Associated Press
